RatSat

Launch RatSat

Description: Ratsat was carried to orbit on the first successful orbital launch of any privately funded and developed, liquid-propelled carrier rocket, the SpaceX Falcon 1

- Information:

  • Flight number: 4
  • Flight date: 28/9/2008
  • Static fire: 19/9/2008
  • Status: Exitoso

Rocket details

Rocket Falcon 1

Information:

State: Inactive

Company: SpaceX

First Flight: 2006-03-24

Country: Republic of the Marshall Islands

Success Rate: 40%

Description: The Falcon 1 was an expendable launch system privately developed and manufactured by SpaceX during 2006-2009. On 28 September 2008, Falcon 1 became the first privately-developed liquid-fuel launch vehicle to go into orbit around the Earth.

Details:

- Rocket Details:

  • Height: 22.25 meters / 73 feet
  • Diameter: 1.68 meters / 5.5 feet
  • Mass: 30146 kg / 66460 lb
  • Stages: 2
  • Boosters: 0
  • Cost per Launch: $6700000

- Engines:

  • Type: merlin
  • Version: 1C
  • Layout: single
  • Thrust vacuum:
  • Engine Loss Max: 0
  • Propellant 1: liquid oxygen
  • Propellant 2: RP-1 kerosene
  • Thrust to Weight: 96

- Payload Weights:

  • Low Earth Orbit: 450 kg / 992 lb
